name: GlideUser
text:
The GlideUser API provides access to information about the current user and current user
  roles. Using the GlideUser API avoids the need to use the slower GlideRecord queries to get user
  information.
text2:
The GlideUser methods and properties are accessed through a global object (g_user) that is only available in client scripts. GlideUser
  • contains name and role information about the current user.
  • is typically used in client scripts and UI policies but is also found in UI actions that run on the client.
  • cannot be used in business rules or UI actions that run on the server.
  • avoids the need for GlideRecord queries to get user information.


Session information about the current user and current user roles is contained in the client (web browser). All GlideUser methods except getClientData() access the session information that is available by default. The getClientData() method requires setup on the server and use of putClientData() to make session information available.

For information on using client-side scripts, see Introduction to Client-side Scripting.

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: filter_func
children.text: Function
children.text2: Filter function that takes a single tour object from the tours[] array returned from getAllTours() method.

children.name: Example
children.text: //create a filter function var filtFunction = function(tour) { //only return those tours whose name starts with âmyâ return tour.name.indexOf(âmyâ) === 0); } //apply the filter top.NOW.guided_tours.api.applyListFilter (filtFunction); //call the getAllTours method to observe the filtered tours top.NOW.guided_tours.api.getAllTours (function(er, tours) { if(!er) { console.log(âThe filtered tours are: â); console.log(tours); } });
children.text2: The following  shows basic API usage.

children.name: Example
children.text: top.NOW.guided_tours.api.applyListFilter(function(tour) { var options = (tour.options)? JSON.parse(tour.options): null; return (options && options.my_param) ? (options.my_param == my_value) : false; });
children.text2: The following shows how to use the options field on the tour object to add JSON with custom tour identifiers for reading and filtering tours inside the filter_func() function.

children.name: applyListFilter(Function filter_func)
children.text: Sets a function to retrieve filtered tour results when the getAllTours() method is called.
children.text2: Complete signature includes top.NOW.guided_tours.api preceding the method name.

children.name: Null
children.text: Â

children.name: Example
children.text: //create a callback function to end the tour if it starts correctly var cbFunction = function(err) { if (err) { console.log(âError Occurredâ); } else { // tour has started so we can call endTour top.NOW.guided_tours.api.endTour(); } } //calling the startTour method so that we can end the tour as soon as it starts top.NOW.guided_tours.api.startTour('a297e04b732313007077edcc5ef6a780', 2, cbFunction);

children.name: endTour()
children.text:
Stops a currently playing tour. This method silently exits if no tours are
    playing.
children.text2: Complete signature includes top.NOW.guided_tours.api preceding the method name.

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: event_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Event name to be removed from the listener.
Valid event names:
  • tourStarted
  • tourEnded
  • tourCompleted
  • tourFailed
  • tourAbandoned
  • tourDismissed
  • stepStarted

children.name: Example
children.text: //create a callback function to handle the result of the api call var eventListenerTourStarted = function() { console.log(âThe tour has startedâ); } var eventListenerTourEnded = function() { console.log(âThe tour has endedâ); } //attaching event listeners for tourStarted and tourEnded Events top.NOW.guided_tours.events.on(âtourStartedâ,eventListenerTourStarted); top.NOW.guided_tours.events.on(âtourEndedâ, eventListenerTourEnded); â¦ //start a tour top.NOW.guided_tours.api.startTour ('a297e04b732313007077edcc5ef6a780', 2, cbFunction); //As soon as the tour starts the eventListenerTourStarted gets fired â¦ top.NOW.guided_tours.api.endTour(); // eventListenerTourEnded gets fired â¦. //removing the event listeners top.NOW.guided_tours.events.off(âtourStartedâ,eventListenerTourStarted); top.NOW.guided_tours.events.off(âtourEndedâ, eventListenerTourEnded);

children.name: listener_function
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Optional. If provided, specified listener function is removed from remaining
                event listeners attached with that event. If not provided, all listener functions
                attached to that event are removed.

children.name: events.off(String event_name, Function listener_function)
children.text: Removes an existing event listener.
children.text2: Complete signature includes top.NOW.guided_tours.api preceding the method name.

children.name: event_name
children.text: String
children.text2:
Event name to be attached to the listener.
Valid event names:
  • stepStarted
  • tourStarted
  • tourEnded
  • tourCompleted
  • tourFailed
  • tourAbandoned
  • tourDismissed

children.name: Example
children.text: //create a callback function to handle the result of the api call var eventListenerTourStarted = function() { console.log(âThe tour has startedâ); } var eventListenerTourEnded = function() { console.log(âThe tour has endedâ); } //attaching event listeners for tourStarted and tourEnded Events top.NOW.guided_tours.events.on(âtourStartedâ,eventListenerTourStarted); top.NOW.guided_tours.events.on(âtourEndedâ, eventListenerTourEnded); â¦ //start a tour top.NOW.guided_tours.api.startTour ('a297e04b732313007077edcc5ef6a780', 2, cbFunction); //As soon as the tour starts the eventListenerTourStarted gets fired â¦ top.NOW.guided_tours.api.endTour(); // eventListenerTourEnded gets fired â¦. //removing the event listeners top.NOW.guided_tours.events.off(âtourStartedâ,eventListenerTourStarted); top.NOW.guided_tours.events.off(âtourEndedâ, eventListenerTourEnded);
children.text2: The following  shows basic API usage.

children.name: Example
children.text: top.NOW.guided_tours.events.on("tourStarted", function (obj){console.log(obj);});
children.text2: The following shows how to use the listener_function parameter with obj as an argument.

children.name: listener_function
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Listener to be added.
Note: Clear any event listener after it solves its purpose.

children.name: listener_function.obj
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Passed to listener_function() by each event in the following format:
  • For stepStarted events: 
    {tour: '<tour_sys_id>', step: step_num}
  • For all other events:
    {tour: '<tour_sys_id>'}
JSON parameters:
  • tour_sys_id: String. Guided tour ID from the Guided Tours [sys_embedded_tour_guide] table
  • step_num: Number. Value between 0 (first step) and n (final step)

children.name: events.on(String event_name, Function listener_function)
children.text: Attaches an event listener to a guided tour event.
children.text2: Complete signature includes top.NOW.guided_tours.api preceding the method name.

children.name: Example
children.text: //create a callback function to handle the result of the API call var cbFunction = function(err, tours) { if (err) { console.log(âError Occurredâ); } else { if(!tours) console.log('No tour present') else { tours.forEach(function(t) { console.log(t); }); } } } //calling the getTours method top.NOW.guided_tours.api.getAllTours(cbFunction);

children.name: cb_function
children.text: Function

Null otherwise.

List of available tours for the page.

If no tours are present on the page, cb_function.tours returns undefined.

if(!tours) console.log('No tour present')

name: Guided Tours
text: Provides methods for launching and stopping guided tours.
text2: This API includes methods used in Guided Tour Designer.

children.name: Example
children.text: function onLoad() { if (g_service_catalog.parent.getValue("address_type") == "ipv4") { g_form.setValue("ipv4_address", "XX.XX.XX.XX"); g_form.setVisible("ipv6_address", "false"); } }
children.text2: In this , a catalog item for blocking multiple IP addresses on a firewall has a variable address_type with two choices - IPV4 and IPV6. The MRVS has two variables (ipv4_address and ipv6_address) for the respective address types. If the Address type field on the parent form is set to IPV4, the field IPV6 address is hidden on the MRVS.

children.name: variableName
children.text: String
children.text2: Name of the variable in the catalog item form to return.

children.name: Array
children.text:
Array of objects, with each object containing the name-value pairs of the requested variable.

For example: [{"city": "San Diego", "country": "USA"}, {"city": "New Delhi", "country": "India"}, {"city": "Melbourne", "country": "Australia"}]

children.name: getValue(String variableName)
children.text:
Returns the value of the specified field on the catalog item form when used in a client
    script on multi-row variable sets (MRVS).
children.text2:
Use this method when an MRVS modal is open for editing or creating and you want to modify data within the MRVS based on the value of a field on the parent catalog item form. For example, when you need to modify the contents of the cells within an MRVS based on a check box on the parent form. You can also use this method to access the data of other MRVS elements within the same parent form.

Note: This method can only be called from the parent object, such as g_service_catalog.parent.getValue().

name: g_service_catalog
text: The g_service_catalog API enables you to access data in a multi-row variable set (MRVS) when a model is open.
text2: This API is available in all environments, such as, Service Portal, Now Platform, Workspace, and NowÂ® Mobile.

children.name: options.size
children.text: String
children.text2:
Size of the modal container. Most sizes automatically expand to fill the viewport when the screen size is small.
Valid values:
  • sm
  • md
  • lg
  • fullscreen

Default: sm

children.name: helpers.modal.open(String modalId, Object options)
children.text: Opens the specified modal on the current page.
children.text2: You can only display one modal at a time within a page. If a modal is currently open, and you call this method, the existing modal is hidden and the new modal appears.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, event, helpers, imports}) { helpers.navigate.setRouteParams({'params': {'selectedTabIndex': 2}}); }
children.text2: This code shows how to append the URL params/selected-tab-index/2. Note that the parameter in the actual URL is changed from camel case to snake case, so selectedTabIndex becomes selected-tab-index.

children.name: params
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Key-value pairs of optional parameters to pass to other components.

This must be a plain, flat object with only primitive values. Array or object references are ignored and not added to the URL. All specified keysâ¯ must be part ofâ¯ the optional parametersâ¯ in the route configuration or they are also ignored. For additional information on optional parameters, see Create a page in UI Builder.

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: helpers.navigate.setRouteParams(Object params)
children.text: Passes the specified parameters down to other components on the same page.
children.text2: Use this method in any page component that wants to add a parameter in a URL. You may want to add a parameter to a URL when another component needs to know the current value of that parameter when it changes, so it can react to it. For example, use this method to pass the selectedIndex of a tab component so it reflected in the URL to give focus to that tab.

children.name: route
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the route. Must be a valid entry from UX App Routes (sys_ux_app_route.list). This value is reflected in the URL, and the URL is created based on the route, fields, and optionalParams column values: /<route>/<field1Value>/{<field2Value>/params/<optionalParamKey1>/<optionalParamValue1>/<optionalParamKey2>/<optionalParamValue2>

For example: /record/incident/12345/params/selectedTabIndex/4

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, event, imports, helpers}) { helpers.navigate.to('test'); }
children.text2: This shows how to navigate to a page passing just the route parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, event, imports, helpers}) { helpers.navigate.to('test', {'key': 'value'}); }
children.text2: This shows how to navigate to a page passing the route and fields parameters.

children.name: fields
children.text: Object
children.text2: Optional. Key-value pairs of required parameters. For example: 'fields' : {'table': 'incident', 'sysId': '12345'}.

children.name: params
children.text: Object
children.text2: Optional. Key-value pairs of optional parameters. For example: 'params' : {'selectedTabIndex': 4}.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, event, helpers, imports}) { helpers.navigate.to('test', {'key': 'value'}, {'first': 'FirstName', 'last': 'Last Name'}); }
children.text2: This shows how to navigate to a page passing the route, fields, and params parameters.

children.name: redirect
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to remove the latest history entry from the browser history. For example, if you navigate to sites A, B and then C. If redirect is set to true while navigating to C, the history entry for B is removed. The browser history only shows only A and C.
Valid values:
  • true: Removes the latest history entry, and redirects to the latest URL.
  • false: Does not remove any history entries.

Default: false

children.name: passiveNavigation
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to perform background navigation. Background navigation is when a page is opened but it is not active or shown. For example, opening an inactive tab for the page, but it is not visible but loaded in the background.
Valid values:
  • true: Perform background navigation.
  • false: Do not perform background navigation.

Default: false

children.name: targetRoute
children.text: String or Object
children.text2:
Sub navigation to a drill-down, deep-link, or sub-tab. If set to current, the current route does a sub-navigation under the current URL.

For example, if /record/incident/123 is the current URL, and the following call is made:

helper.navigate.to('record', {'table': 'problem', 'sysId': '567'}, {}, false, false, 'current');

The following URL is generated: /record/incident/123/sub/record/problem/567

Note: targetRoute can be either a string such as 'current' or an object, such as navigation NAV_ITEM_SELECTED payload.

children.name: helpers.navigate.to(String route, Object fields, Object params, Boolean redirect, Boolean passiveNavigation, String targetRoute)
children.text:
Navigates from one screen to another based on the specified route and field
    information. URL changes and the respective screen loads are observed.

children.name: Example
children.text: screen.updateStatus({âdirtyModalIdâ: âcustomModalIdâ, âisDirtyâ: true});

children.name: statusObj
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Payload to send to the current page to report that the content has been updated.
Valid values:
  • dirtyModalId: (String) ID of the modal that has changed.
  • hasError: (Boolean) Flag that indicates that there are errors on the page.
  • hasUpdate: (Boolean) Flag that indicates that there were updates to the page.
  • icon: (String) Name of the updated or new icon.
  • isDirty: (Boolean) Flag that indicates whether the page is dirty (values have changed).
  • message: (String) Updated/new message.
  • screenKey: (String) ID of the screen on which the change occurred. Every screen has a screenKey as a property on the screen macroponent inside sn-canvas-screen.
  • status: (String) Status operation for this action. This value must be one of the following: inserted, deleted, saved, or closed.
  • title: (String) Updated/new display title.
  • tooltipPreview: (JSON) Updated or new tool tip. For example, tooltipPreview : { primaryTitle, secondaryContent: {} }

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: helpers.screen.updateStatus(Object statusObj)
children.text:
Enables pages to report their status updates, such as title, icon, dirty state,
    message, and error changes.
children.text2: Status updates are reported to WorkspaceChrome or AppShell, whichever the outer layer is, and acting as the host.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, event, helpers, imports}) { helpers.snHttp('/api/now/table/u_movie', {method: 'GET'}) .then(({response}) => { // do something with the table data }) .catch(({error}) => { const message = `Error: ${error.data.error.message}`; console.error(message); api.emit('NOW_UXF_PAGE#ADD_NOTIFICATIONS', { id: 'alert5', status: 'high', icon: 'info-circle-outline', content: message, action: { type: 'dismiss' } }); }); }
children.text2: The following show how to call snHttp() which returns a promise.

children.name: url
children.text: String
children.text2: HTTP endpoint relative to the instance URL. For example, /api/now/table/incident or /api/now/table/incident/a83820b58f723300e7e16c7827bdeed.

children.name: error
children.text:
Object that describes any error returned by the REST API.

Data type: Object

"error": {
  "data": "String",
  "message": "String",
  "options": {Object},
  "status": Number,
  "statusText": "String"
}

children.name: Example
children.text: async function handler({helpers}) { try { const result = await helpers.snHttp('/api/now/table/u_movie', {method: 'GET'}); } catch ({error}) { const message = `Error: ${error.data.error.message}`; console.error(message); api.emit('NOW_UXF_PAGE#ADD_NOTIFICATIONS', { id: 'alert5', status: 'high', icon: 'info-circle-outline', content: message, action: { type: 'dismiss' } }); } }
children.text2: The following show how to call snHttp() using async and await.

children.name: error.data
children.text:
Response returned from the HTTP API.

Data type: Defined by REST API

children.name: options
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Describes the contents of the HTTP request.
"options": {
  "batch": Boolean,
  "body": {Object},
  "headers": {Object},
  "method": "String"
}

children.name: error.message
children.text:
Message describing the error encountered when trying to process the HTTP request.
Note: This parameter is not always returned.

Data type: String

children.name: options.batch
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Optional. Flag that indicates whether this HTTP request should be batched with other HTTP requests made to the instance.
Valid values:
  • true: Make request as part of a batch request.
  • false: Make dedicated request.

Default: true

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers, event, imports}) { helpers .snHttp("/api/now/table/incident", { method: "POST", body: { description: "Sample description", close_notes: "Sample close notes", order: "-1" } }) .then(({ response }) => { // handle POST request response }) .catch(({ error }) => { // handle POST request errors }); }
children.text2: The following  show how to set up a POST request.

children.name: error.options
options.body
children.text: Object
children.text2:
Optional. Data to send as the request body. Only applicable for request methods PUT, POST, and PATCH. Elements in the object depend on the type of HTTP method. For details, refer to the code examples below.

Default: {}

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers, event, imports}) { helpers .snHttp("/api/now/table/incident/a83820b58f723300e7e16c7827bdeed2", { method: "PUT", body: { activity_due: "1970-04-02 18:26:17" }, headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json", "Accept": "application/xml" } }) .then(({ response }) => { // handle PUT request response }) .catch(({ error }) => { // handle PUT request errors }); }
children.text2: The following  show how to set up a PUT request.

children.name: options.headers
children.text: Object

children.name: error.options.headers
children.text:
Object containing a list of all of the request headers sent in the request.

Data type: Object

children.name: error.options.responseHeaders
children.text:
Object containing a list of all of the response headers sent in the request.

Data type: Object

children.name: options.method
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. HTTP method.
Valid values:
  • DELETE
  • GET
  • PATCH
  • POST
  • PUT

Default: GET

children.name: error.status
children.text:
Returned HTTP error status code, such as 400, 405, or 500.

Data type: Number

children.name: error.statusText
children.text:
Returned HTTP status message, such as Bad Request.

Data type: String

children.name: response
children.text:
Returned when HTTP request is successful. The response to the HTTP request.

Data type: Any

children.name: helpers.snHttp(String url, Object options)
children.text: Makes an HTTP request to the ServiceNow instance and returns a promise with the results.
children.text2:
Note: There is a known issue where objects named options are omitted from the HTTP response.
{
  options: {},
  otherFields: {}
}

becomes

{
  otherFields: {}
}

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers}) { api.setState('intervalId', ({currentValue}) => { if (currentValue > -1) { helpers.timing.clearInterval(currentValue); } return -1; }); }
children.text2: This shows using clearInterval() to cancel a timing operation that was previously set using thesetInterval() method. This function could be invoked by a user clicking a Disable Auto-refresh button on a page.

children.name: timeoutId
children.text: Number
children.text2: Unique identifier of the scheduled function to clear. This value is returned by the corresponding setInterval() call.

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: helpers.timing.clearInterval(Number timeoutId)
children.text: Cancels the execution of the function that was scheduled through a prior setInterval() call.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers}) { api.setState('timeoutId', ({currentValue}) => { if (currentValue > -1) { helpers.timing.clearTimeout(currentValue); } return -1; }); }
children.text2:
This code  shows how to terminate a timer with the specified
          <var class="keyword varname">timeoutId</var>.

children.name: timeoutId
children.text: Number
children.text2: Unique identifier of the scheduled function to clear. This value is returned by the corresponding setTimeout() call.

children.name: None
children.text: Â

children.name: helpers.timing.clearTimeout(Number timeoutId)
children.text: Cancels the execution of the function that was scheduled through a prior setTimeout() call.

children.name: fn
children.text: Function
children.text2: Function to repeatedly execute.

children.name: Number
children.text: Unique identifier of the function execution operation. Use this value in the helpers - helpers.timing.clearInterval(Number timeoutId) method if you need to cancel this operation.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers}) { // Every one second, refresh the value of current timestamp client state parameter const intervalId = helpers.timing.setInterval(() => { api.setState('currentTimestamp', new Date().toString()) }, 1000); // The interval ID is kept in state to use when calling the helpers.timing.clearInterval() method at a later point api.setState('intervalId', intervalId); }
children.text2: This code shows how to refresh the timestamp on a page every second. This function could be invoked by a user clicking an Enable Auto-refresh button on a page.

children.name: delay
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Length of the time-interval between each function execution.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: helpers.timing.setInterval(Function fn, Number delay)
children.text:
Repeatedly executes the specified function, using the specified delay value as the
    interval between function calls.
children.text2: Unlike the native JavaScript setInterval() method, this method does not support passing a code string to evaluate as the first argument. Any additional arguments are passed to the function itself.

children.name: Number
children.text: Unique identifier of the function execution operation. Use this value in the helpers - helpers.timing.clearTimeout(Number timeoutId) method if you need to cancel this operation.

children.name: fn
children.text: Function
children.text2: Function to execute.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler({api, helpers}) { const timeoutId = helpers.timing.setTimeout(() => { api.emit('NOW_UXF_PAGE#ADD_NOTIFICATIONS', { id: 'alert5', status: 'high', icon: 'info-circle-outline', content: 'Try to look away at something that is 20 feet away from you for a total of 20 minutes.', action: { type: 'dismiss' } }); }, 20 * 60 * 1000); // The timeout ID is kept in state to use when calling the helpers.timing.clearTimeout() method at a later point api.setState('timeoutId', timeoutId); }
children.text2: This code shows how to set a 20 minute timer. You could associate this function with a button Remind me in 20 minutes.

children.name: delay
children.text: Number
children.text2:
Length of the time to wait before calling the specified function.

Unit: Milliseconds

children.name: helpers.timing.setTimeout(Function fn, Number delay)
children.text: Executes the specified function, after the specified delay.
children.text2: Unlike the native JavaScript setTimeout() method, this method does not support passing a code string to evaluate as the first argument. Any additional arguments are passed to the function itself.

children.name: Example
children.text: function handler ({api, helpers}) { helpers.translate(âWelcome {0} {1}!â, user.firstName, user.lastName) .then((translatedText) => { api.setState('greeting', translatedText); }); }
children.text2:
The following  shows how to pass in table field references to embed in the
        corresponding variables in a string, using a promise.

children.name: String
children.text: Translated text string.

children.name: message
children.text: String
children.text2: Message to translate.

children.name: Example
children.text: async function handler ({api, helpers}) { const translatedText = await helpers.translate('Welcome to {0}', 'ServiceNow'); api.setState('greeting', translatedText); }
children.text2: The following shows how to use async and await in your function instead of a promise.

children.name: tokens
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Comma-separated list of parameters to use for replacing string variables.

For example:

helpers.translate('Text {0} {1}', 'to', 'translate');

children.name: helpers.translate(String message, String tokens)
children.text:
Asynchronously retrieves and translates the specified message based on the current
    user's session language.
children.text2:
You can use this method with the api - setState(String stateParam, Any value) to bind the translated value to other fields on the page.

Note: You can call this method using a promise or async and await. The code examples below show both implementations.

name: helpers - UI Builder
text: The helpers API provides general functionality that is common across page scripts, eliminating the need to write scripts for simple functionality such as opening and closing a modal.
text2:
This API is only available to page scripts, it is not available in any other UI Builder scripts including:
  • component property value scripts
  • component visibility scripts
  • event payload scripts
  • UX client script includes

children.name: Example
children.text: // Returns: "The rich young ruler was very very rich" nowapi.g_i18n.format("The {p1} {p2} {p3} was very very {p1}",{p1: "rich", p2: "young", p3: "ruler"});

children.name: String
children.text: The formatted string

children.name: message
children.text: String
children.text2: The message to have the tokens added.

children.name: map
children.text: Object
children.text2: The map of name/value pairs to replace in the message.

children.name: format(String message, Object map)
children.text: Formats a string containing named tokens with values from a map.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: msgKey
children.text: String
children.text2: The message to be retrieved.

children.name: callback
children.text: Function
children.text2:
The function to be called when the message has been retrieved. The callback
                function has one argument, a string that is the translated message.

children.name: getMessage(String msgKey, Function callback)
children.text: Retrieves a translated message.
children.text2: If the specified string exists in the database for the current language, then the translated message is returned. If the specified string does not exist for the current language, then the English version of the string is returned. If the string does not exist at all in the database, then the ID itself is returned.

children.name: msgKeys
children.text: Array
children.text2: An array of keys specifying the messages to be retrieved.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: callback
children.text: Function
children.text2:
The function to be called when the messages have been retrieved. The callback
                function has one argument, an object containing key-value pairs, where key is the
                requested message key, and the value is the translated string.

children.name: getMessages(Array msgKeys, Function callback)
children.text: Retrieves a set of messages.
children.text2: If the specified string exists in the database for the current language, then the translated message is returned. If the specified string does not exist for the current language, then the English version of the string is returned. If the string does not exist at all in the database, then the ID itself is returned.

name: i18NV3
text: Provides methods to get and format translated messages.
text2: The i18N methods are accessed using the g_i18n global object.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The field name.

children.name: Example
children.text: function onChange(control, oldValue, newValue, isLoading) { // if the caller_id field is not present, then we can't add an icon anywhere if (!g_form.hasField('caller_id')) return; if (!newValue) return; g_form.getReference('caller_id', function(ref) { g_form.removeDecoration('caller_id', 'icon-star', 'VIP'); if (ref.getValue('vip') == 'true') g_form.addDecoration('caller_id', 'icon-star', 'VIP'); }); }
children.text2: This  adds a VIP icon next to the caller.

children.name: icon
children.text: String
children.text2: The font icon to show next to the field.

children.name: text
children.text: String
children.text2: The text title for the icon (used for screen readers).

children.name: addDecoration(StringÂ fieldName, StringÂ icon, StringÂ text)
children.text: Adds a decorative icon next to a field.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (g_user.hasRole('itil')) { var oldLabel = g_form.getLabel('comments'); g_form.setLabel('comments', oldLabel + ' (Customer visible)'); }

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The field name.

children.name: String
children.text: The label text.

children.name: getLabel(StringÂ fieldName)
children.text: Gets the form label text.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (g_form.hasField('assignment_group')) g_form.setMandatory('assigned_to', true);
children.text2: This  makes the assigned_to field mandatory if the assignment_group field is on the form.

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The field to look for.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
True if the field is present on the form; false, if it is not. On the form means that the
                field is part of g_form. It could still be hidden, read-only, mandatory, or
                invalid.

children.name: hasField(StringÂ fieldName)
children.text: Determines if a field is present on the form.
children.text2: Present means that it can be shown, not that it is visible.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The field name.

children.name: Example
children.text: function onChange(control, oldValue, newValue, isLoading) { // if the caller_id field is not present, then we can't add an icon anywhere if (!g_form.hasField('caller_id')) return; if (!newValue) return; g_form.getReference('caller_id', function(ref) { g_form.removeDecoration('caller_id', 'icon-star', 'VIP'); if (ref.getValue('vip') == 'true') g_form.addDecoration('caller_id', 'icon-star', 'VIP'); }); }

children.name: icon
children.text: String
children.text2: The icon to remove.

children.name: text
children.text: String
children.text2: The text title for the icon.

children.name: removeDecoration(StringÂ fieldName, StringÂ icon, StringÂ text)
children.text: Removes a decorative icon from next to a field.

children.name: Example
children.text: if (g_user.hasRole('itil')) { var oldLabel = g_form.getLabel('comments'); g_form.setLabel('comments', oldLabel + ' (Customer visible)'); }
children.text2: This  changes the comments label.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: fieldName
children.text: String
children.text2: The field name.

children.name: label
children.text: String
children.text2: The field label text.

children.name: setLabel(StringÂ fieldName, StringÂ label)
children.text: Sets the form label text.

name: Mobile GlideForm (g_form)
text:
Mobile GlideForm (g_form) methods enable you to work with forms on the mobile
    platform.
text2: Use these methods in any script that targets a mobile device.

children.name: initializeVendorClientLazily
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to use the autoSelectVendorCallback function passed in the setCallerId() method to automatically set the caller's associated vendor (notifyConfig.vendor does not need to be defined in the constructor).
  • false: Default. Do not use the autoSelectVendorCallback function to set the caller's vendor. The vendor must be set in the constructor.
  • true: Use the autoSelectVendorCallback function to define the vendor when the caller ID is set.

children.name: Example
children.text: jQuery(function () { var notifyConfig = { autoLoadScriptResources: true // This will take care of auto loading the JS resources needed by the client (if any) }; var client = new SNC.Notify.Client(notifyConfig, true); // The second argument ensures that the proper vendor for the given number is auto determined client.setCallerId('valid_notify_long_number', function () { // This is called after the vendor has been determined. if (!notifyConfig.vendor) // Means this number has no compatible vendor return; client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.ONLINE, function () { // Ability to call is available }); client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.OFFLINE, function () { // Ability to call is _not_ available right now }); client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.ERROR, function (msg, code) { // Some error happened }); //... register other event handlers here //Show UI elements which can be used to invoke client.call() and other APIs client.init(); // This is important to call this. }); });
children.text2:
The following  shows how to create the NotifyClient constructor, register various
        event listeners, and initialize the client driver.

children.name: notifyConfig
children.text: Object
children.text2:
JSON object that contains the configuration settings for the Notify WebRTC
                Client.

children.name: notifyConfig.autoLoadScriptResources
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates how to load the core JS library needed by the vendor client.
  • false: Default. Use vendor specific codes to load the required vendor JS library (enables backwards compatibility).
  • true: Use notifyClient.js to load the core JS library.

children.name: notifyConfig.callerId
children.text: Number
children.text2: Registered Notify number to use. Do not directly set this value. Use the method notifyClient.setCallerID() to set this value.

children.name: notifyConfig.forceRefreshToken
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to auto-renew expired client tokens.
  • false: Do not automatically renew client tokens when they expire.
  • true: Default. Automatically renew client tokens when they expire.

children.name: notifyConfig.skipParentId
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to immediately invoke the onIncoming caller for incoming calls.
  • false: Default. Do not immediately invoke the onIncoming event handler.
  • true: Immediately invoke the onIncoming event handler. By setting this flag, if there is another call, where the <Dial><Client> Twiml caused the incoming call, then setting this flag causes the system to auto poll the backend. This auto poll obtains the parent notify_call reference.

children.name: notifyConfig.vendor
children.text: Constant
children.text2:
Vendor to which the caller belongs.
  • SNC.Notify.Vendor.TWILIO_DIRECT
  • SNC.Notify.Vendor.TWILIO (older, deprecated Twilio driver)

children.name: Client(Object notifyConfig, Boolean initializeVendorClientLazily)
children.text: Instantiates a new Notify WebRTC Client object.

children.name: Example
children.text: jQuery(function () { var notifyConfig = { autoLoadScriptResources: true // This will take care of auto loading the JS resources needed by the client (if any) }; var client = new SNC.Notify.Client(notifyConfig, true); // The second argument ensures that the proper client for the given number is auto determined client.setCallerId('valid_notify_long_number', function () { // This is called after the client has been determined. if (!notifyConfig.vendor) // Means this number has no compatible client return; client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.ONLINE, function () { // Ability to call is available }); client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.OFFLINE, function () { // Ability to call is _not_ available right now }); client.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.ERROR, function (msg, code) { // Some error happened }); //... register other event handlers here client.init(); // This is important to call this. }); });
children.text2: This  shows how to register multiple listeners.

children.name: event
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the event to listen for.

Instead of passing strings, use the constants defined in SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.

  • CALL_START: call has started and is in progress.
  • CALL_CANCEL: caller canceled the call.
  • CALL_INIT: WebRTC connected to a call (incoming or outgoing).
  • CALL_DISCONNECT: current call has been disconnected.
  • ERROR: Error occurred. Parameters: message(string), errCode(string)
    • message: error message to display.
    • errCode: Optional. Associated error code.
  • INCOMING_CALL: Call is coming in. Parameters: from(string), to(string), callId(string), parentId(string), sysId(string), isFromClient(boolean)
    • from: caller's phone number.
    • to: called phone number.
    • callId: SID of the call.
    • parentId: parent notify_call reference. If skipParentId is set to true, this parameter should not be passed.
    • sysId: WebRTC-to-WebRTC calls only. Unique identifier (sys_id) of the caller.
    • isFromClient: WebRTC-to-WebRTC calls only. Flag that indicates whether the call is from another WebRTC client.
  • CALL_MUTE: client is muted.
  • CALL_UNMUTE: client is unmuted.
  • OFFLINE: WebRTC session is not active.
  • ONLINE: WebRTC session is ready. Must be set after calling the init() method.

children.name: Function
children.text: Function to use to de-register a listener.

children.name: Example
children.text: var dereg = notifyClient.addEventListener(SNC.Notify.STD_EVENTS.ONLINE, function () { ... }); dereg(); // The event listener function is no longer triggered.
children.text2: This  shows how to de-register a listener.

children.name: addEventListener(String event, Function fn)
children.text: Registers an event handler to listen for changes in a Notify client.
children.text2: Using this method you can register multiple listeners. Each listener must be a separate method call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: identifier
children.text: Object
children.text2:
JSON object that contains either a phone number to call or the sys_id of a WebRTC user. Passing a user sys_id causes the call to be made through browser-to-browser communication.

You can obtain the user sys_id from the Notify WebRTC Session table.

Note: If you provide both a phone number and user sys_id, the method only uses the phone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: notifyClient.call({ phoneNumber: "+18001112223" });
children.text2: This  demonstrates passing a phone number as the function parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: notifyClient.call({ userId: "6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441" });
children.text2: This  demonstrates passing a user record sys_id as the function parameter.

children.name: Example
children.text: $j("#pickupCallBtn").on("click", function() { notifyClient.hangupCall(); });
children.text2: This  shows a button click handler.

children.name: Example
children.text: onConnect: function(status) { // webRTC receives a call connection event (incoming or outgoing). if (status == SNC.Notify.Status.OPEN) { setStatus(getTimeStamp() + " -- Successfully established call"); showHangupButton(); } },
children.text2: This  shows an event handler.

children.name: call(Object identifier)
children.text:
Calls the specified phone number or the phone number associated with a specified
    user.
children.text2: Note: When checking the status of a call/connection, always compare against the constants provided by SNC.Notify.Status.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: destroy()
children.text: Kills the current Notify client, rendering it unusable.

children.name: Example
children.text: var arg = { type: "number", id: "+17012345678", dtmf: "1234" } client.forwardCall(arg);
children.text2:
This  demonstrates forwarding a call to a different phone number. The dtmf attribute
        allows you to send DTMF dial tones to the receiving number.

children.name: argument
children.text: Object
children.text2:
JSON object that contains the necessary information for forwarding the call to
                either a phone number or a WebRTC client (user sys_id). You can obtain this sys_id
                from the Notify WebRTC Session table.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var arg = { type: "userId", id: "6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441" } client.forwardCall(arg);
children.text2: This  demonstrates forwarding a call to a different Notify client.

children.name: forwardCall(Object argument)
children.text:
Forwards an ongoing incoming or outgoing phone call to either a different phone number
    or a different WebRTC client.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: callback
children.text: Function

children.name: getAvailableClients(Function callback)
children.text: Returns a list of clients available to accept calls.
children.text2: This method excludes the current client from the list. The equivalent Notify-getAvailableClients() method does not filter any user.

children.name: String
children.text: Parent call identifier.

children.name: callId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Unique identifier of the call for which to return the parent call
                identifier.

children.name: Example
children.text: notifyClient.getParentId( callId, function(jsonObj) {} );
children.text2: This  shows how to use this method to obtain the parent call identifier.

children.name: Example
children.text: { parentId: "xyz", error: "msg" }
children.text2: This  shows the contents of the jsonObj parameter.

children.name: callback
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Function that obtains the JSON object that contains either the parent call
                identifier or an error message if the identifier could not be obtained after several
                tries.

children.name: getParentId(String callId, Function callback)
children.text:
Returns the parent call identifier for a specified call identifier, if one
    exists.
children.text2: Depending on the telephony provider, there may be a delay before the parent call identifier is returned; therefore you must provide a callback function.

children.name: Example
children.text: clientStatus = notifyClient.getStatus();
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the status of the current Notify client.

children.name: String
children.text:
Current status of the call. The values returned by the telephony provider API
                are normalized by replacing the returned driver value with its equivalent value as
                defined in SNC.Notify.Status.

children.name: getStatus()
children.text: Returns the normalized status of the current call.

children.name: Example
children.text: $j("#pickupCallBtn").on("click", function() { notifyClient.hangupCall(); });
children.text2: This  how to hang up a call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: hangupCall()
children.text: End the current call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: $j(function() { notifyClient = new SNC.Notify.Client( notifyConfig ); notifyClient.setCallerId( '+31858889170' ); notifyClient.init(); });
children.text2: This  shows how to initialize the Notify client.

children.name: init()
children.text: Initializes the client driver.
children.text2: For example, when using the Twilio client, it invokes the method Twilio.Device.setup(). Call this method after the user has interacted with the page. This initialization process is asynchronous, therefore, you must provide an ONLINE event handler. This handler is called when the setup process is complete and the system is ready to take or make calls.

children.name: muted
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Mutes or unmutes the current call.
  • false: (or any non-true value) unmutes the current call.
  • true: mutes the current call.

children.name: Example
children.text: notifyClient.mute( "true" );
children.text2: This  shows how to send mute the current call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: mute(Boolean muted)
children.text: Mute or unmute the current client.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: $j("#pickupCallBtn").on("click", function() { notifyClient.pickupCall(); });
children.text2: This  shows how to pickup a call.

children.name: pickupCall()
children.text: Answers and connects to an incoming call from a WebRTC client.
children.text2: Call this method when there is a notification of an incoming call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: notifyClient.SendDtmf( "1246AF" ) {} );
children.text2: This  shows how to send DTMF signals to the current call.

children.name: digits
children.text: String
children.text2: One or more DTMF-valid digits.

children.name: sendDtmf(String digits)
children.text: Send one or more DTMF-valid digits over the current call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: value
children.text: String
children.text2: Phone number to use to make and receive calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: $j(function() { notifyClient = new SNC.Notify.Client( notifyConfig ); notifyClient.setCallerId( '+31858889170' ); notifyClient.init(); });
children.text2:
This  shows how to set the caller ID. This example assumes that the vendor is set in
        the constructor.

children.name: autoSelectVendorCallback
children.text: Function
children.text2:
Optional.initializeVendorClientLazily must be set to "true" in the constructor to use this function, otherwise an error is thrown.

Name of the callback function to call once the vendor is automatically set for the specified phone number. With this option, the vendor does not need to be specified in the constructor (notifyConfig.vendor). Auto vendor selection is an asynchronous operation. Therefore, this callback is required to indicate when it is safe to call notifyConfig.init(), as this method requires that the vendor be set before it is called. In addition, you must also check if notifyConfig.vendor has been set in the callback to ensure that a vendor has been specified.

children.name: setCallerId(String value, Function autoSelectVendorCallback)
children.text: Sets the caller ID for the current client session.
children.text2: You can change or update the caller ID at any time however, the caller ID must belong to the same vendor.

children.name: available
children.text: boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether an active WebRTC client wants to receive calls.
  • false: client does not want to receive calls.
  • true: client does want to receive calls.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: setClientAvailable(Boolean available)
children.text: Sets the availability of an active WebRTC client agent.
children.text2:
This type of availability is different than an agent being in a call. In this case, an active WebRTC client may be connected and not on a call, but may not want to receive calls.

Calling this method updates the Available field value on the Notify Client Connected Session [notify_client_session] record associated with this client session. You can get a list of available clients using the getAvailableClients() method.

name: NotifyClient
text:
The NotifyClient API allows you use Notify telephony functionality, such as making and
  receiving calls, from a web browser.
text2:
Several NotifyClient methods take a callback function as a parameter. Because NotifyClient
   calls are made asynchronously, these methods cannot return a value directly. Use the callback
   function to parse the returned data, such as by assigning variables or making other API
   calls.

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: Example
children.text: function addToConferenceCall() { var data = NotifyOnTaskClient.getNotifyActionTemplate(); data.serviceProvider = 'Telephony'; // e.g 'Zoom', 'WebEx' data.confId = 'Active conference sysId'; data.items.push({ id: 'userSysId' }); data.items.push({ phoneNumber: '+917799555331' }); data.items.push({ email: 'yln99518@gmail.com' }); NotifyOnTaskClient.addParticipants(data).then(function (result) { var joinActionResult = result[0]; if(joinActionResult.status) { joinActionResult.successMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.log(msg); }); return; } joinActionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.warn(msg); }); joinActionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.error(msg); }); }, function (errMsg) { console.log(errMsg); }); }

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

children.name: data.confId
children.text: String
children.text2: Required. Sys ID of the conference call. The conference Sys ID is located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call] table.

children.name: data.items
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Required. Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: User Sys ID; located in the User [sys_User] table.
  • notifyParticipantId: Participant Sys ID; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.
  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.
  • email: email address of the participant.

children.name: data.message
children.text: String
children.text2: Message that is read aloud when a user answers the call, such as, "P1 incident has been created please login to instance."

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text: String
children.text2: Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

children.name: data.sysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

You should configure this value when the conference call is initially created through a "start" action. If required, you can also set this value through this method.

children.name: data.table
children.text: String
children.text2:
Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

This table name is stored in the Table column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.sysId, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

You should configure this value when the conference call is initially created through a "start" action. If required, you can also set this value through this method.

children.name: addParticipants(Object data)
children.text: Adds the specified participants to a specified conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: /** * * @param {string} action - action to perform on the conference object or participant object * @param {Array} participants; */ function doConferenceAction(action, participants) { var data = NotifyOnTaskClient.getNotifyActionTemplate(); data.serviceProvider = 'Telephony'; // e.g 'Zoom', 'WebEx' data.confId = 'Active conference sysId'; data.items = participants; NotifyOnTaskClient.doConferenceAction(action, data).then(function (result) { var kickActionResult = result[0]; if (kickActionResult.status) console.log(action + ' succeeded'); else { kickActionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.warn(msg); }); kickActionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.error(msg); }); } }, function (errMsg) { console.log(errMsg) }); } // kick participants doConferenceAction('kick', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // kick multiple participants doConferenceAction('multiKick', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}, {notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // Mute participants doConferenceAction('mute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); doConferenceAction('mute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); doConferenceAction('multiMute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}, {notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // self join to any confernece. doConferenceAction('selfJoin', [{id: 'logged in userId'}]);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to create a function to call doConferenceAction() to
        manipulate the participants in a conference call by passing in the action and the
        participants.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: action
children.text: String
children.text2:
Defines the conference call action to perform.
The following are the available conference call actions:
  • start: Starts the conference call identified in data.confId
  • end: Terminates the conference call identified in data.confId
  • join: Adds the participant specified in the data.items array to the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiJoin: Adds the participants specified in the data.items array to the conference call identified in data.confId
  • selfJoin: Adds the currently logged in user to the conference call (no entry in data.items required.)
  • kick: Removes the participant specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiKick: Removes the participants specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • mute: Mutes the participant specified in the data.items array on the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiMute: Mutes the participants specified in the data.items array on the conference call identified in data.confId
  • unmute: Unmutes the participant specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId
  • multiUnmute: Unmutes the participants specified in the data.items array from the conference call identified in data.confId

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin

children.name: data.allowMulticonference
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to allow multiple conference calls for a specific record at one time.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record that is allowed to have multiple conference calls.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.confId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys ID of the conference call.

The conference Sys ID is located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • end
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin
Note: Participant actions such as mute, unmute, and kick do not require this parameter to be set as the method obtains this information from the Notify Conference Call Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: data.fromNumber
children.text: String
children.text2:
Service provider number to call into for the conference call.

Locate this value in the Number or Phone number column of the Notify Phone Number [notify_number] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • start

children.name: data.isNewConference
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether this is a new or an existing conference call.

Valid values:

  • true: New conference call
  • false: Existing conference call

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.message
children.text: String
children.text2:
Message that is read aloud when a user answers the call, such as, "P1 incident has been created please login to instance."

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin

children.name: data.items
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: Sys ID of user; located in the User [sys_User] table.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • notifyParticipantId: Sys ID of the Notify participant; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

    Valid actions: join, kick, multiJoin, mute, start, unmute

  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • email: Email address of the participant.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • all

children.name: data.sysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.table
children.text: String
children.text2:
Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

This table name is stored in the Table column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.sysId, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: doConferenceAction(String action, Object data)
children.text:
Performs the specified conference call action, such as starting/ending a conference
    call or joining, removing, muting, or unmuting participants from a conference call.
children.text2:
You can start a new conference call and add participants within a single call to this method or call the method multiple times to start the call and then manage participants separately. In addition, through the passed in data object, you can configure the method to:

  • Save pointers in the conference call record to the specific record (source record), such as an incident or problem, that is the topic of discussion for the conference call.
  • Allow/disallow multiple conference calls for a source record.
  • Automatically log the participants that were in the conference call in the Work notes field of the source record.
  • Have a message read aloud when a participant answers an outgoing call from the conference.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: function endConferenceCall() { var data = NotifyOnTaskClient.getNotifyActionTemplate(); data.serviceProvider = 'Telephony'; // e.g 'Zoom', 'WebEx' data.confId = 'Active conference sysId'; NotifyOnTaskClient.endConference(data).then(function (result) { var endActionResult = result[0]; if (endActionResult.status) console.log('Conference has been ended'); else { endActionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.warn(msg); }); endActionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.error(msg); }); } }, function (errMsg) { console.log(errMsg); }); }

children.name: data.confId
children.text: String
children.text2: Sys ID of the conference call.

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text: String
children.text2: Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

children.name: endConference(Object data)
children.text: Terminates the specified conference call.

children.name: data
children.text: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: /** * * @param {string} action - action to perform on the conference object or participant object * @param {Array} participants; */ function doConferenceAction(action, participants) { var data = NotifyOnTaskClient.getNotifyActionTemplate(); data.serviceProvider = 'Telephony'; // e.g 'Zoom', 'WebEx' data.confId = 'Active conference sysId'; data.items = participants; NotifyOnTaskClient.doConferenceAction(action, data).then(function (result) { var kickActionResult = result[0]; if (kickActionResult.status) console.log(action + ' succeeded'); else { kickActionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.warn(msg); }); kickActionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function (msg) { console.error(msg); }); } }, function (errMsg) { console.log(errMsg) }); } // kick participants doConferenceAction('kick', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // kick multiple participants doConferenceAction('multiKick', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}, {notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // Mute participants doConferenceAction('mute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); doConferenceAction('mute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); doConferenceAction('multiMute', [{notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}, {notifyParticipantId: 'notifyParticipantSysId'}]); // self join to any confernece. doConferenceAction('selfJoin', [{id: 'logged in userId'}]);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to call getNotifyActionTemplate() to obtain the data
        template necessary to define the actions for doConferenceAction().

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin

children.name: data.allowMultconference
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether to allow multiple conference calls for a specific record at one time.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record that is allowed to have multiple conference calls.

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.confId
children.text:
Sys ID of the conference call.

The conference Sys ID is located in the Notify Conference Call [notify_conference_call] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • end
  • join
  • multiJoin
  • selfJoin
Note: Participant actions such as mute, unmute, and kick do not require this parameter to be set as the method obtains this information from the Notify Conference Call Participant [notify_participant] table.

children.name: data.fromNumber
children.text:
Service provider number to call into for the conference call.

Locate this value in the Number or Phone number column of the Notify Phone Number [notify_number] table.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • start

children.name: data.isNewConference
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether this is a new or an existing conference call.

Valid values:

  • true: New conference call
  • false: Existing conference call

Default: false

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.items

Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: Sys ID of user; located in the User [sys_User] table.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • notifyParticipantId: Sys ID of the Notify participant; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.

    Valid actions: join, kick, multiJoin, mute, start, unmute

  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

  • email: Email address of the participant.

    Valid actions: join, multiJoin, start

children.name: data.message
children.text:
Message that is read aloud when a user answers the call, such as, "P1 incident has been created please login to instance."

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start
  • join
  • multiJoin

children.name: data.serviceProvider
children.text:
Required. Name of conference service provider, such as Zoom or Webex.

Actions for which this parameter is required:

  • all

children.name: data.sysId
children.text:
Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: data.table
children.text:
Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

This table name is stored in the Table column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.sysId, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

Actions for which this parameter is valid:

  • start

children.name: getNotifyActionTemplate()
children.text: Returns a JSON data template to use with the doConferenceAction() method. Using this template automatically structures the data object so that you don't have to manually create it.
children.text2:
Call this method prior to calling the doConferenceAction() method. For the desired conference call action, set the desired parameters within the template, and then pass the template in the doConferenceAction() call. For additional information on the valid parameters for each action, see doConferenceAction().

Note: This is a helper method. You can also manually construct this object and pass it into the doConferenceAction() method and have the same outcome.

children.name: Example
children.text: function startConferenceCall() { var data = NotifyOnTaskClient.getNotifyActionTemplate(); data.table = 'incident'; data.sysId = '1234'; data.serviceProvider = serviceProvider; data.addToWorkNotes = true; data.fromNumber = 'Telephony Number'; data.items.push({ id: 'userSysId' }); data.items.push({ phoneNumber: '+917799555332' }); data.items.push({ email: 'yln99517@gmail.com' }); NotifyOnTaskClient.start(data).then(function (result) { var startActionResult = result[0]; if(startActionResult.status) { startActionResult.successMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.log(msg); }); return; } startActionResult.warnMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.warn(msg); }); startActionResult.errorMessages.forEach(function(msg) { console.error(msg); }); }, function (errMsg) { console.log(errMsg); }); }

children.name: data
children.text: Object
children.text2: Object that describes the conference call.

children.name: Object
children.text:
Results of the conference action.

<action>.status: Status of the conference action.

  • Data type: Boolean
  • Valid values:
    • true: Conference action succeeded
    • false: Conference action failed

<action>.successMessages: If status is true, success message(s), else empty.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.warnMessages: If status is false, any warning messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

<action>.errorMessages: If status is false, any error messages thrown during processing.

  • Data type: Array of Strings

children.name: data.addToWorkNotes
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Optional.Flag that indicates whether to add information about the participants that were included in the conference call in the work notes field of the associated record.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values for the data.table and data.sysId parameters to identify the record in which to add the work notes.

Default: false

children.name: data.allowMulticonference
children.text: Boolean
children.text2:
Optional. Flag that indicates whether to allow multiple conference calls for a specific record at one time.

For this functionality to work, you must also specify values in the data.table and data.sysId parameters. These parameters identify the record that is allowed to have multiple conference calls.

Default: false

children.name: data.fromNumber
children.text: String
children.text2:
Required. Service provider number to call into for the conference call.

Locate this value in the Number or Phone number column of the Notify Phone Number [notify_number] table.

children.name: data.items
children.text: Array
children.text2:
Optional. Information for each participant to include in the conference call.

Valid array values:

  • id: User Sys ID; located in the User [sys_User] table.
  • notifyParticipantId: Participant Sys ID; located in the Notify Participant [notify_participant] table.
  • phoneNumber: Phone number of the participant. If this value is passed in conjunction with either the id or notifyParticipantId, this value supersedes the phone numbers in the user/participant record and is used to place the call.
  • email: Email address of the participant.

children.name: data.sysId

Optional. Sys ID of the source record to associate with the conference call.

For example, if a conference call is held to discuss a specific incident or problem, put the Sys ID of the incident or problem record in this value. This Sys ID is stored in the Source column of the NotifyConference Call [notify_conference_call] table and can later be tracked.

This parameter is used in conjunction with the data.Table, data.addToWorkNotes, and allowMulticonference parameters.

children.name: data.table

Optional. Table that contains the source record to associate with the conference call. A source record can be any record, such as an "incident" or "problem", that is the topic of discussion in the conference call.

children.name: start(Object data)
children.text: Starts a new conference call.

name: NotifyOnTaskClient
text: The NotifyOnTaskClient API provides methods for sending SMS messages or starting/managing a conference call for various telephony service providers, such as Zoom and WebEx.
text2:
Any UI can consume the NotifyOnTaskClient API by explicitly including the NotifyOnTaskClient UI script.

Using the NotifyOnTaskClient API you can:

  • Start a conference call
  • End a conference call
  • Add participants
  • Perform actions that are available through the telephony driver such as:
    • mute/unmute participants
    • remove participants from a conference call
    • add participants to a conference call
    • start a conference call
    • end a conference call


The Notify (com.snc.notify) plugin requires a separate subscription. For additional information on activating the Notify plugin, see Activate Notify.
